intro: Bellis purpurascens, commonly known as the purple alpine daisy, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features small, daisy-like flowers with purple petals and a yellow center, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and grayish-green in appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Bellis purpurascens is often found in meadows and alpine tundra, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
